intro: Blakea setosa, commonly known as the slender blakea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Blakea setosa is often found growing on trees or in dense undergrowth, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
